API Authentication Guide

This guide explains how to add authentication to your API. We use OAuth 2.0 for secure access control. Each request needs a valid token to work.

How It Works

The system uses JSON Web Tokens for authentication. These tokens are signed with a secret key. The server checks each token before processing requests.

Getting Started

To authenticate your requests, you need to follow these steps. First, register your application. Then, get your client credentials from the dashboard.

  • Set up the authorization server endpoint in your config file.
  • Add token refresh logic to handle expired sessions.
  • Rotate your signing keys every 90 days for security.
  • Log all authentication failures for debugging.

Making Requests

Add the token to your request headers. Use the Bearer scheme for the authorization header. The server validates the token and returns your data.

Error Handling

When a token expires, you get a 401 error response. Use your refresh token to get a new access token. If the refresh fails, ask the user to log in again.
